title: How to Make Baking Soda Naan on a Griddle

steps.headline: Sift together the all purpose floor, baking soda and salt.
In a mixing bowl, add the cooking oil to the sifted floor mixture.
Add the yogurt to the flour.
Add lukewarm water little by little.
steps.description: This is done to ensure that you get soft (but not sticky) dough. Only add sufficient water to soften.

steps.headline: Knead the dough well on a flat, lightly floured surface.
Apply a little oil to the dough.
steps.description: Cover and keep aside in a warm place for about 3 hours.

steps.headline: After three hours, the dough is ready for use.
steps.description: Take a big lemon-sized ball of dough and roll it on a flat, lightly floured-surface. Aim for the teardrop/pear shape. It should not be too thin nor too thick, ideally less than ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) in thickness.

steps.headline: Heat the griddle.
steps.description: When the griddle is hot enough, put the rolled naan on it. When bubbles form on the naan, turn it over and cook on the other side as well.

steps.headline: Remove from the griddle.
steps.description: Immediately apply butter or ghee all over the naan.

steps.headline: Garnish the naan with chopped cilantro.
steps.description: Serve it hot with any gravy-based Indian side dish.

text: Sift together the all purpose floor, baking soda and salt.  In a mixing bowl, add the cooking oil to the sifted floor mixture. Mix well. Add the yogurt to the flour. Mix well. Add lukewarm water little by little. This is done to ensure that you get soft (but not sticky) dough. Only add sufficient water to soften. Knead the dough well on a flat, lightly floured surface.  Apply a little oil to the dough. Cover and keep aside in a warm place for about 3 hours. After three hours, the dough is ready for use. Take a big lemon-sized ball of dough and roll it on a flat, lightly floured-surface. Aim for the teardrop/pear shape. It should not be too thin nor too thick, ideally less than ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) in thickness. Heat the griddle. When the griddle is hot enough, put the rolled naan on it. When bubbles form on the naan, turn it over and cook on the other side as well. Remove from the griddle. Immediately apply butter or ghee all over the naan. Garnish the naan with chopped cilantro. Serve it hot with any gravy-based Indian side dish.
